body: @dereuromark  IMO the minimum date should be moved to **SQLDialect** because, for example, on MSSQL, using datetime2, the min date is 0001-01-01

> Can we accept dates before that? No? Why?

We haven't had many use-cases for dates prior to the 1800s. The current restrictions date back to https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/commit/33fbace4c77040acf2379bc1e9463e6f580feeef#commitcomment-7145913

@markstory A simple case of a classic Books and Authors would be invalidate by Cake Validation. I am not complaining, but I would suggest that thing like that should take advantage of each SQLDriver and be consistent with theirs respective limit (and not a generic regex validation). Would be a nice addition to Cake 4.x :)

Being consistent with the SQL layer is not simple as we accept multiple formats that are not handled by all database vendors. If you'd like to extend the year range to 0001 I think that's reasonable as that value can be represented by PHP's datetime well enough.

Such a pity because would be a differential of Cake ORM, invalidate, for example 1752-12-01 using datetime1 on mssql but validates on mysql. Well, at least, could we have an information about the 1600 limit on book and api? Or simply remove it, like you said, to 0001

I agree that any year starting with 0001 should be considered valid.
@celsowm Would you like to submit a patch for it?
Yes I would! My first patch! Would be a pleasure!

issue.title: Allow dates before 1600 to be valid

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
Expand the valid date range to start at 0001 instead of 1600. This makes validating historical dates simpler as they are now valid.

Fixes #13441
